Many free tools available, but the most well known for
free are Abbot, JFCUnit and Jemmy. Marathon is up
there, but more of a QA/User based testing tool, where
as the other three are used to allow a qa person with
java dev experience, or a developer, to write code
that uses the API of the library of choice to automate
the UI, by finding components, and sending
mouse/keyboard events to controls.



--- "Krishna Kishore TV." <kishore@...> wrote:

>
